page.title: 03Cockermouth Mountain Rescue
page.content: In 1953{John Bell}founded the Cockermouth Mountain Rescue Service. The present team consists of 34 men who help people who are injured or lost on the fells.The leader is{Jim {Coyle}and people from all lines of work are in the team,like bankmanagers ,teachers and even a vicar.You have to be 18 or over to join and there is no pay.Their area covers{Buttermere}and {Ennerdale.}The worst place for mishaps is{Sourmilk Ghyll}where many people tragically died. The{Mountain Rescue H.Q.}is in {Fairfield Car Park,}Cockermouth.It has a garage,a briefing room,a radio room, a recharging room and a drying room. The most important pieces of equipment are two Land Rovers.The Land Rovers have powerful two way radios in them. The radios do not function in hilly ground so they have telescopic aerials
